Pernille Harder (Denmark, Linkoping and Wolfsburg), Dzsenifer Marozsán (Germany, Lyon) and Lieke Martens (Netherlands, Rosengard and Barcelona) are the three nominees for the women's award. The players who make up the rest of the top 10 are: 4: Luka Modric (Croatia, Real Madrid) 5: Toni Kroos (Germany, Real Madrid)
raw_results.sampled: Italy and Juventus goalkeeper Buffon, Argentina and Barcelona striker Messi and Portugal and Real Madrid forward Ronaldo were chosen by a jury of football journalists as the three finalists for the 2006 FIFA World Player of the Year award. The announcement was made at a ceremony in Berlin, Germany, on December 17, 2006. Buffon was named the winner after a dominant year in which he helped Juventus win the Serie A title and led Italy to victory at the 2006 World Cup. Messi was the runner-up, while Ronaldo finished in third place. This was the first time that a goalkeeper had won the award since Lev Yashin in 1963.
